items.title: 'Evil and sick': Bondi shooting survivor speaks out after losing his father
items.description: Ya'akov Tetleroyd's father died in the Bondi Beach shootings. He nearly lost his arm as a result of being shot, yet he told 7.30 in an exclusive interview that he forgives the gunmen.

items.title: Man suffers critical leg injuries in shark attack at Sydney beach
items.description: A man in his 20s is in a critical condition after he sustained leg injuries in another shark attack at a Sydney beach.

items.title: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies after alleged assault
items.description: Former Labor strategist Tim Picton dies in hospital, weeks after he was allegedly assaulted outside a Perth nightclub.

items.title: Iranian official says deaths in Iran protests reach at least 5,000
items.description: The death toll includes about 500 security personnel and exceeds that of any other round of protest or unrest in Iran in decades.

items.title: 'Now it is time': Trump's Greenland threats grow after Europe sends troops
items.description: Tensions between the United States and Greenland's allies reach a new high, with threats of increasing tariffs after European troops were sent to the island.

items.title: Live: Tomljanović battles back from set down to beat brave qualifier
items.description: Australian wildcard Priscilla Hon gets her first main draw singles win at Melbourne Park since 2020 as Marina Stakusic succumbs to cramps, while men's sixth seed Alex de Minaur starts his grand slam campaign with a straightforward victory on Rod Laver Arena. Follow live.

items.title: 'Irregular flight school practices' linked to triple-fatal plane crash
items.description: An investigation finds risky flying behaviour, an amateur-built aeroplane's "design deficiencies" and issues at the pilot's flight school may have contributed to a fatal light aeroplane crash in Victoria in 2024.

items.title: Author's lawyer serves second concerns notice to SA premier
items.description: Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah says her lawyer has served a second concerns notice for defamation on South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas.

items.title: Why Donald Trump could exploit the US's 250th birthday for his own gain
items.description: The United States of America is celebrating the 250th anniversary of its union as a nation and experts say Donald Trump appears to be exploiting the events for his own political gain.

items.title: Deadly Chile wildfires trigger state of catastrophe
items.description: Wildfires raging across central and southern Chile have left at least 18 people dead, scorched thousands of hectares of forest and destroyed hundreds of homes, local authorities say, as the South American country swelters under a heat wave.

items.title: 'I am still trembling': At least 39 dead after high-speed train crash in Spain
items.description: At least 39 people have died and dozens are severely injured after two high-speed trains derailed in southern Spain, local authorities say.

items.title: 'They were everywhere': Eye-catching 'smack' of red jellyfish washes ashore on Melbourne beaches
items.description: Visitors of Melbourne's eastern beaches over the weekend were surprised to see an influx of crimson jellyfish bobbing in the water. One expert says a "perfect storm" of factors has brought them to the coastline.

items.title: AI is an ethical, social and economic nightmare and we're starting to wake up
items.description: As 2025 began, I thought humanity's biggest problem was climate change. In 2026, AI is more pressing.

items.title: Calls to tax super-rich more as number of global billionaires hits record
items.description: Oxfam Australia is calling on the federal government to tax the super-rich to help tackle growing inequality, as billionaires grow their wealth by more than half a million a day on average.

items.title: Residents in WA community urged to stay out of floodwaters after weekend deluge
items.description: People living in Kalumburu, one of the most remote communities in Western Australia's far north, are being warned of rising river levels and floods, after heavy rain.

items.title: Teen dies of injuries at bottom of cliff near Jerrabomberra Waterhole
items.description: A member of the public tried to perform CPR on a teenage boy suffering serious injuries at the bottom of a cliff near Canberra, but he died at the scene.

items.title: What psychologists have to say about the seven types of rest
items.description: Have you ever found yourself still exhausted and deflated after an eight-hour sleep? Perhaps sleep isn't the reset you need.

items.title: Smith speaks on T20 future ahead of World Cup
items.description: Steve Smith has lit up the Big Bash since returning to the Sydney Sixers, but concedes the ship has sailed for him to play in next month's T20 World Cup.

items.title: Man faces NT court over seizure of 2kg of meth
items.description: A 22-year-old man has faced court after police allegedly found 2 kilograms of methamphetamine, along with large quantities of other drugs, during a traffic stop in Katherine last week.

items.title: Nicolas Cage shrine amid weird pranks at Mount Gambier deputy mayor's home
items.description: A Nicolas Cage-themed shrine is the latest of a series of celebrity-themed pranks that Mount Gambier's deputy mayor says have befallen his home in recent weeks.

items.title: Reugg defies the odds to defend Tour Down Under title
items.description: After being dropped on the first two ascents of a pivotal section of the final stage, Switzerland's Noemi Reugg fights back brilliantly to claim back-to-back Tour Down Under victories.

items.title: How WA went from leader to loser in the illegal tobacco wars
items.description: Burnt out storefronts in Perth and regional cities are testament to the government's inability to control the illegal tobacco trade — and it's not clear when things will change, writes Keane Bourke.

items.title: Perth's median house price surges through $1 million mark
items.description: Domain's latest quarterly house price report has found the cost to buy a home increased by 9.9 per cent in the last quarter of 2025, to a median of $1,087,762.

items.title: Dingoes 'had been in contact' with deceased woman's body on K'gari beach
items.description: Police say the woman was working at a backpacker's hostel and went for an early morning swim.

items.title: Celebrity chef among the new faces at $800m Sydney Fish Market
items.description: It is perhaps the most expensive seafood centre of its kind, but just what can visitors expect from the new $800 million Sydney Fish Market?
